intro: Lastrea kohautiana, commonly known as the red-flowered lastrea, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and vibrant red flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
